title: Upvote to keep riven disabled.
body: I don't care much about zed but riven disabled is a blessing upon this game.

BS mobility and AD scaling shield, as well as the feared and powerful..

Fuck {{champion:92}} whoever designed her must have been retarded it's the only explanation for such a stupid kit.
To be fair, she wasn't designed around her animation cancelling, which she would be much less painful to go against without.

She wasn't designed to use AA cancelling, yes, but Riot decided to let is slide. Cause, y'know.. who cares if Riven deals like 3x more damage in 1 second..


But Riot just had to remove Alistars/Vaynes free AA after pulverize/headbutt/condemn/tumble (not sure which exactly). Double standarts.

Be thankful they nerfed her q damage to attempt to balance her around the animation canceling, he was super hell in the past before that.

Literally hit 6

R > Q > Q > Q > R You are fking dead. She clears the minion wave goes back to base comes back into lane. Her ult is back up and guess what? R > Q > Q > Q > R You are dead again.

That still leaves little for her early game. I hate her, slide dash + shield. Its retarded. Lucian needs mana just to use his dash, with no shield. True, he gains a extra 50% damage (or 100% on minions) for his next attack and it does go down to being free at rank 5, but it still doesn't also follow up with a stun. I mean, honestly, a stun? That deals 100% of her AD!? At least Corki's R is more balanced than her Q. His R deals 60/120/180 (+40/50/60% AD) every 2 or so seconds. Her Q can deal 10/30/50/70/90 (+40/45/50/55/60% AD) 3 times, so up to 30/90/150/210/270 (+120/135/150/165/180% AD). Just dealing 2 strikes can deal 20/60/100/140/180 (+80/90/100/110/120% AD). And it even has a knock-up. Didn't Rek'Sai just get a nerf on her knock-up range? Because it was annoying. The only thing she's missing is a heal, tenacity, and armor reduction.

You know you're comparing apples to oranges? "It's so unfair that Kassadin can spam dashes when Riven can't. It's so unfair that Garen has a silence when Riven doesn't."
It's just not a good comparison, you gotta compare her to other fighters with the same playstyle, and you gotta compare the entire kit too.
Until you realise, Riven can spam more mobility then Kassadin by a large margin :o

They need to remove it.  They're all about interactivity and shit, they got rid of Veigar's ragecage, but Riven's success or failure is still 100% balanced around whether or not the person playing her can hit buttons really fast.  (Not faster than you, mind.  That'd give you some influence.  She's racing against herself)

Riven is zero-interactivity.  I've never outplayed a Riven, when I beat her it's cause she outplayed herself.

As opposed to Riven, where her entire gimmick is finding ways to break the game's original animations to destroy your lane opponent with no counterplay.
Any champion top lane that can interrupt her combo screws her over hard, {{champion:86}} and {{champion:106}} for example.

I already did calculations on garen vs riven situation, you can check them. RIven outdamages garen even with his silence. Also, voli wont interupt her combo, he has only 1 hard cc and after that riven will continue to combo.

Oh good damage must surely be the sole reason anyone wins or loses a matchup right? 

Whats skill?

Items?

Timing?

Jungler aid?

Runes and masteries?

Overall playstyles?

What about minion aggro?

But it's baffling you think calculating who does more damage means they don't counter her.

Here better yet http://champion.gg/champion/Riven/Top

If you go down below you see her counters, and this actually uses stats that matter.

They dont. You see, the whole concept of a counter, is that the counter should completely win against a riven in an equal skill situation.

If garen would counter riven, he would outtrade her and have the ability to win the lane. However, i made calculations and on EQUAL skill basis riven objectively wins every trade possible and wins the lane.

Is that why her winrate is lower when she is against Garen or Volibear?

Because that means these champions excel against her, they exceed at winning against her in comparison to other champions, implying they counter her.

She can out trade all she wants, but a silence from Garen fucks her over every single time.

A Q into the minion wave as Voli coupled with his W is a massive blow early on.

Here, all the calculations, in this scenarion its at level 3, if you wish i can do a calculation every 3 levels. This is comparison of an equal skill matchup.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Okay, lets do some calculations.

Riven is level 3 with plus 15 ad runes starting with longsword. Riven, hp 685, ad 60, armor 29.(base stats). Riven, hp 685, ad 85, armor 29.(Full stats)

Garen is level 3 with plus 15 armor runes starting with cloth. Garen, hp 758, ad 63 armor 31.5.(base stats). Garen, hp 685, ad 63, armor 63.(Full stats)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Riven skill damage. Q - "Broken wings" 10+34*3 = 132 ad damage. W - "Ki burst" 50 + 25 = 75 ad damage. E "Valor" 90 + 25 = 115 hp shield.

In the time of garen doing his q/e combo a riven will easily pull off at least 4 aa. Passive - "Runic blade" 85 + 17 * 4 = 408.

Total = 132 + 75 + 408 = 615 ad damage.

Garen skill damage. Q - "Decisive strike" 30 + 88.2 = 118.2. W - "Courage" Passive already calculated in the full stats and active will be calculated in the defence stats. E - "Judgement" 20 + 44.1 * 3 = 192.3.

Total = 118.2 + 192.3 = 310.5 ad damage.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Riven, defence round. 29 armor = 77,519% incoming damage. Garens damage = 240.7. Rivens shield is unafected by armor so it blocks only 115 damage with no reduction applied.

So basically Riven will receive only about 180 damage to her hp.

Garen defence round. 63 armor = 61,350% incoming damage. Riven damage = 377.3025, garen can use his W, to further increase his defences by 30% for 2 seconds, so 2 aa from rivenbasically are under effect. so the already reduced by armor damage is firther reduced by the skill. Meaning that 204 * 0.61350 multiplied by 0.7 = 87.6.

Garen will receive about 300 damage to his hp.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Result, Garen, the great riven counter, is unable to outtrade her.

You are trying to decide counter picks solely on damage and out trading.

If you aren't seeing the problem with this then I am not saying more.

BEcause garen wont outsustain her which i have already said before.

Why are counterpick, counterpicks? Because they beat and somehow are better than their opponent champ. If garen was rivens counter he would outdamage her solo and win against her. However, he doesnt. How does a counter not outdamage and does not win vs his counter champion?

Riven has no sustain?

Garen has his passive to quickly recover from trades.

And you still haven't explained why Garen has a higher winrate towards Riven, and Rivens is lower towards Garens. Since winrate actually means something in this case.

Your math does not take into account any poking or harass, any form of counterplay, any minion aggro, or any summoners, it assumes Riven and Garen go head strong into each other which is a terribly unrealistic scenario.

Jesus christ are you riven lovers reading any of the shit i post or do you look at 1 sentence and write instantly!

Garens sustain has 9 sec cooldown, riven will easily outtrade him and wont let him keep his passive. The only way he will keep his passive is not farming!

And again i will repeat, winrate has over 100000 variables in it. Just because garen has a 2% higher chance to win vs her than some other champ it doesnt mean he is the counter since the numbers say that he is not.

Also these "winrate" statistics do not account for riven mids which usually do not encounter garens which results in such situations that garen actually palys top and riven is mid or even jungle in some cases.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
My math doesnt take into account poking or harass because neither of them will do it because its just bad for both of them. If riven tries to do it garen will q and get away and nothing will happen.

If garen tries it riven will w/e combo it and thats it. Neither of them can poke eachother out in equal skill situation.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About counterplay. In case you dont know how to read i will repeat. EQUAL SKILL SITUATION!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Minion aggro isnt counted because neither of them will be stupid enough to initiate eachother in a minion wave. If garen does that he loses, if riven does that she loses.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Summoners arent taken into consideration because most of the time it will be the same combination ignite/ignite or tp/tp. Also summoners do not matter when you compare the strenght of champions themselves.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Because of these reasons the only scenarion that you can objectively compare the power of these two champions is straight up 1 on 1 duel. BEcause every other scenario wont happen in equal skill match up.

I don't main Riven or enjoy or company and find myself rolling my eyes whenever I am against her, which tells you something because maybe people disagree with you because your logic is bullshit?

> Garens sustain has 9 sec cooldown, riven will easily outtrade him and wont let him keep his passive. The only way he will keep his passive is not farming!

But in order for her to do this she needs to attack him, meaning she will take minion aggro. Which you said "They wouldn't be stupid enough to initiate each other in a minion wave" and well unless Garen is on her side she is going to take some hefty damage.

For the bolded text, do you know the meaning of irony? You using there ability to trade blows with each other as a sole way of determining this despite the many variables I continue to point out to you?

> Because of these reasons the only scenarion that you can objectively compare the power of these two champions is straight up 1 on 1 duel. BEcause every other scenario wont happen in equal skill match up.

I will elaborate when I said an equal skill match up doesn't exist. Because it doesn't exist. No 2 people are alike in gameplay mechanics or mentally, there is no such thing as equal strength, you are playing to an unrealistic scenario and that's why you aren't agreed with because you are using a scenario that can't exist. If 2 people were equal completely in mechanics, that doesn't stop the other one from simply being smarter or having better instincts. If we had 2 people completely mentally the same, same everything possible, well that doesn't exist.

I can objectively compare power because I have statistics to know who builds what, levels what up, and who wins against who. We don't need to argue math when we can just look and see she loses against X more often then wins. From this we can conclude this X champion does well against her, and being a counter does not ever imply Riven has no chance of winning type of thing, or Riven can't become a victor because get this, an equal skill matchup doesn't exist.

Sorry about the first part. Its getting annoying when i have to rewrite everything for 100 time because someone didnt bother to read....

1) By my damage calculations, riven simply kills garen on the second all in. I know it depends on them going all in at the first trade. But without this they wouldnt trade at all really.

2) I looked up rivens win ratio against garen in Champion.gg Guess what. IT is 50.42%. IF garen indeeed was a counter to riven he would have higher winrate than he has now, wouldnt he?

And about that "irony". See i disregard winrate as a stasitic just because you cannot remove variables from it or change them and there are 1000000 of them. The number because of that is extremelly volatile and everchaning.

In my calculations however, i made sure to controll all the variables like in an experiment. In my calculations unlike those in winrates, extra variables just didnt exist and pure power was being compared.

3) Mate, i once mained garen. I know his match ups inside and out, especially vs riven which was a really popular pick in season 3. That is just what happens in every trade/poke scenario.

Riven wont use her q just to farm a wave, she will save it for engagements or to run away, doing otherwise is bad for her and she wouldnt really do it.

4) In reallity. No. IN calculations however, you have to consider it. WHen you compare a champions power or strenght in comparison to other champions you have to remove all the variables, that includes the human factor.

5) They can, but if either one of them fights in the others minion wave, it will still hurt.

6) I did not take into account summoners because they were an extra variable to be removed and also, most of the time you will see the same summoners there.

We both know that there is in reality only 1 summoner slot, other is reserved for flash (With some exceptions).

7) I know that equal skill match up in reality doesnt exist. But you cant discuss champion balance otherwise. You just have to remoev all variables, that includes the human factor. This is the only way to compare a champions raw power.

8) Even the statistics show that riven is not countered by garen (win rate above, you can check if you do not believe, site is Champion.gg). And usage of math is like doing an experiment in this case, it gives results and show what happens. 

If garen was indeed the counter to riven.


1. He would have higher winrate against her.

2. He could outtrade her.

He doesnt have either. Being a counter doesnt imply that a riven cannot win. However, if you are a counter, you must be capable of outtrading or winning vs your opponent. Which in raw power doesnt happen with riven.

Oh, the good old winrate argument. You do realise that winrate depends on over 1000000 variables? Even 1 damage can change the whole outcome of the game.

Win rate never shows any reliable information as it depends on too many variables to be trusted.


Also, another thing. This is not objective. Numbers however, are objective. And OBJECTIVELY by counting NUMBERS you can count, that riven in EQUAL SKILL match up outdamages both of these guys.

Wait a bit im gonna do some digging and show you the calculations that are objective.

And yet you are using just 1 variable to decide whether he counters or not.

With no actual response to why her winrate is about 3% lower against Volibears or 2% lower against Garens.

I mean obviously the ONLY thing that matters is damage so she should have a higher winrate towards them right?

And winrate is only bad when used as a means to justify balance, in the case of "Does X do bad or good against Y" It's perfect.

Wait. YOu do realise that 2% is numerically insignificant number. Right? If it was 10 percent at least, then we could talk. The differentce being 3% is just laughable, its insignificant and youi cant draw conclussions from such a low variation in number.

Alright I am definitely sure you don't know anything about reading statistics, not only is your scenario not the same thing, but you think a drop by a few percentiles is insignificant.

On average Riven will win 52.62% of her games overall. 

If she goes against a Volibear her winrate becomes 48.99% remember this is an average, and it tells us she loses more games against Volibear in comparison to Shyvanna (61.31%) where on average she will win more games towards her.

You severely underestimate a couple percentages and use 1 variable to justify something with hundreds, if a champions win rate drops against other champions you don't focus on it going down by a couple numbers you notice she loses more often then she wins against X champion.

I do know about numbers. And 2% from 50% variation is an insignificant number. Plus. Winrate is an unreliable statistic because it depends on 100000 variables. There cabn be situations when riven wins her lane and demolishes these counters but still loses game. THere can be situations when riven mids/jungles with those "counters" at top lane.

Your so called "significant" percentiles and statistics do not account for these variables when counting win rates. Meaning they are unreliable.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If we would use your system to count for champion balance we should buff all below 50% win rates even 49% rates and nerf every above 50% rates even 51% rates. Have you ever heard of measurement bias? When in certain number range for example from 48%-52% numbers are considered close enough to 50% so they do not count as significantly changed. And as such do not matter.

These rates change constantly, weekly, monthly. They are even changing and reliant on too many different variables. All of this makes for completely unreliable data which fails to show how strong champions are or how champs fight against another champs.

What if after 1 month volibear vs riven winrate becomes 52%? What then? See my point? DId volibear become less of a counter to riven in 1 month with no changes? No, he didnt. But the winrate changed.

These aren't collected based solely on winning her game, you can check there average end game stats to find this stuff out.

And it isn't hard for champion.gg to calculate if Riven is jungling or not because she will have smite, and if she happens to be mid it will figure it out based on which tower or champion she fights. If Garen and Aatrox are top and Riven is killing Ahri, and taking mid tower chances are she is mid.

And why are you using If scenarios? I am not using winrates to decide balance, nor implying or suggesting anything similar to the scenario you are painting.

Also you don't know what measurement bias is, it's misreading statistics not disregarding a range due to possible changes.

Volibear or Garen have never lost more against Riven in history so far, so yes if that occurred I would be surprised.

Well i mean, winrate as a statistic, is based on someone winning a game. For example someone can have 100 games with shen, but win 20%. That someones winrate with shen could indicate that he sucks with him, however, that someone has a 12 kda with shen and wins his lane easily.

This doesnt mean he will win the game however, and winrate as a statistic wont care who won the lane, it will only care who won the game.

What i meant is that these smart pecentage differences do not matter in the big picture because they are in "acceptible" so to say range. THey are not outliers by 10% or more, they are in an "Acceptible" range, just because they are 1% winning more games doesnt mean much, because of that really low percentage change.

Well first of all, if I am reading this correctly (and I might not be), your math is wrong. I don't care to actually check if the numbers themselves are accurate, but I don't really feel the need to either.

Riven's total damage when not mitigated by anything is 615, yeah? 

And with an armour value of 63, Garen would take 61.350% of the damage, right?

That alone would reduce Riven's damage to 377.3025. Already below the "400 damage to his hp" you were talking about, right?

Only the 30% DR mitigates this even further. Assuming it does indeed only mitigate two autos, that's about 116.40 less damage. So Riven would actually be doing more like 250 damage to Garen. Once more, assuming the numbers you're using are entirely correct.

So Riven is taking 180 damage, and Garen about 250.

This is of course assuming Riven gets to unload literally her entire combo on Garen, which seems unlikely considering he can silence it to break it and get free damage on her. 

So in this hypothetical situation that heavily favors Riven for some reason, she takes less damage than Garen. Only Garen is far better able to sustain back any health he loses.

Oh, and what about minion aggro? Shouldn't that be taken into account? Were Riven to engage, she would draw it after all. They don't exist in a void.

Yes, i have to apologise, it seems that i made a mistake in some of my calculations (happens when you have to do 20 of them in such a short time).

So if we do the correct numbers the damage would be 377 (lets make it so because all those extra numbers are annoying to write)

Autoattack with w reduction is correct as far as i can see.

So all in all, yes, my calculations were wrong, however yours were a bit wrong too, because after the seemingly right calculations we still have garen taking about 300 damage while riven gets that 180.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About the situation itself. Look. This is the best way to see champion power levels in a fighting situation. WIth no other variables. This situation doesnt favor riven, it is just a simple situation in which you can put any champion vs any other champion.

While fights do not happen in a void, when talking about balance you have to make situations like these.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now about the sustain. IT doesnt really matter. You see, for garen to have a lot of sustain, he needs not to get hit for 9 seconds. That is hard to do, especially vs riven. She can combo and combo you over and over again because she has no resources. Yes, garen can drink health pots. But even they wont give enough hp in such a fast time.

Lets also not forget that sustainability, while it is a bit of rivens weakness is not such a big deal. She does build lifesteal, early it will be weak, but noticeable. in mid/late game,  that problem takes care of itself. She wont heal like mundo, but it will be enough for trades and staying in lane.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Why i do not count minion aggro and other situations other than a straight up fight? Because that is how you need to look at champ balance and other situations wont really have impact. 

Minion aggrro, both of them have aoe abilities. A smart riven/Garen wont initiate in a full wave of minions, however, this brings up another problem. Because in that case they both have to afk farm.
